NetLocalGroupAddMembers will add one or more users to a local security group. The function encapsulates [http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa370436%28VS.85%29.aspx NetLocalGroupAddMembers] function from the Windows Network API using level 0 parameters.

==Parameters==
|| *Name* || *Type* || *Description* ||
|| GroupName || String || The name of the local group to add members to. ||
|| Members || String or Array || The user or users/groups to add to the group. ||

==Return Value==
The function will return an array of error codes that specify whether each specified user was added. If only one user was specified, it will return an array with a single value. A value of 0 from the array indicates success.

==Remarks==
The members parameter will accept either usernames or a string version of a valid SID. If you pass a username, the function will internally call [http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa379159%28VS.85%29.aspx LookupAccountName] to resolve it into a SID. Calling [http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa379159%28VS.85%29.aspx LookupAccountName] is inefficient because it will have to contact and authenticate against a domain controller if the specified user/group is in a domain.
